member.name: T:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSItem
member.summary: Represents a RSS Item in a RSS Channel.

member.name: M:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSItem.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This represents one RSS Item. This constructor fits the base requirements for an RSS Item
member.param: The Title of the RSS Item
The URL of the Item
A short description of the RSS Item.

member.name: M:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSItem.ToString
member.summary: Will return the items portion of the RSS feed.
member.returns: XML for this Item in RSS format

member.name: P:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSItem.Title
member.summary: The title of the item. Read Only.

member.name: P:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSItem.Link
member.summary: The URL of the item. Read Only.

member.name: P:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSItem.Description
member.summary: The item synopsis. Read only.

member.name: P:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSItem.AuthorsEmail
member.summary: Email address of the author of the item

member.name: P:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSItem.AuthorsName
member.summary: The Authors Name

member.name: P:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSItem.Categorys
member.summary: Includes the item in one or more categories.

member.name: P:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSItem.CommentsPage
member.summary: URL of a page for comments relating to the item.

member.name: P:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSItem.ItemEnclosure
member.summary: Describes a media object that is attached to the item.

member.name: P:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSItem.PubDate
member.summary: Indicates when the item was published.

member.name: P:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSItem.Guid
member.summary: A unique Identifier for this Item. If this is left as null it will use the links property for generating one. Can be any values, just as long as it is unique to the item and does not change.

member.name: P:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSItem.GuidIsPermaLink
member.summary: Wether or not the Guid is an actual link or not. Default is false.

member.name: P:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSItem.Extensions
member.summary: A list of custom tags. This is used to extend RSS. You need to make sure to include the namespace for the tag in the channel.

member.name: T:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSEnclosure
member.summary: This is applyed to Items that should have files associated to them. All feilds are required.

member.name: M:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSEnclosure.#ctor(System.String,System.UInt64,System.String)
member.summary: This is used for attaching files to an RSS feed. All fields are required for campatability of the standard.
member.param: The URL of the media file.
The size in Bytes of the file
The Mime Type for that file

member.name: P:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSEnclosure.EnclosureURL
member.summary: The URL of the media file.

member.name: P:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSEnclosure.Length
member.summary: The size in Bytes of the file

member.name: P:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSEnclosure.MimeType
member.summary: The Mime Type for that file

member.name: M:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSExtensionTag.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a specialized tag for tags that are not native to RSS 2.0 but are included bacause of an RSS namespace decleration
member.param: The RSS Name space (i.e. Atom or Itunes)
The special namespace tag
What goes between the begining and closing tags.

member.name: M:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSExtensionTag.ToString
member.summary: Returns the RSS for this extension.
member.returns: Returns the RSS for this extension.

member.name: P:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSExtensionTag.Extension
member.summary: The RSS Name space (i.e. Atom or Itunes). Read-only.

member.name: P:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSExtensionTag.Tag
member.summary: The special namespace tag. Read-only.

member.name: P:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSExtensionTag.Value
member.summary: What goes between the begining and closing tags. Read-only.

member.name: P:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSExtensionTag.Attributes
member.summary: Allows you to set attributes for the extension

member.name: T:SimpleDotNetRSS.SimpleRSSLink
member.summary: Generates a link on your page for the rss if your page has implimented the ISimpleDotNetRSS interface.

member.summary: Writes out the html for the control.

member.name: P:SimpleDotNetRSS.SimpleRSSLink.ImageBorder
member.summary: Do you want an Image border or not?

member.name: P:SimpleDotNetRSS.SimpleRSSLink.Text
member.summary: The Text to display if the control is not an image button, or the alt text if it is an image button.

member.name: P:SimpleDotNetRSS.SimpleRSSLink.ImageUrl
member.summary: The images location for the image button."

member.name: P:SimpleDotNetRSS.SimpleRSSLink.ImageButton
member.summary: Set to true to Have the control render as an image button.

member.name: T:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSCategory
member.summary: Represents a category that you want your RSSItem or RSSChannel to have.

member.name: M:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSCategory.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Stores a category for the RSS Channel or Item
member.param: The category to be added

member.name: M:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSCategory.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Stores a category for the RSS Channel or Item. If you don't understand the domain paramater, don't use this constructor.
member.param: The category to be added

The value of the element is a forward-slash-separated string that identifies a hierarchic location in the indicated taxonomy. Processors may establish conventions for the interpretation of categories. An example is: http://www.fool.com/cusips

member.name: M:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSCategory.ToString
member.summary: Returns the RSS Category Eliment.

member.name: P:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSCategory.Domain
member.summary: The value of the element is a forward-slash-separated string that identifies a hierarchic location in the indicated taxonomy. Processors may establish conventions for the interpretation of categories. An example is: http://www.fool.com/cusips

member.name: P:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSCategory.CategoryText
member.summary: Stores a category for the RSS Channel or Item. If you don't understand the domain paramater, don't use this constructor. Read-Only.

member.name: T:SimpleDotNetRSS.ISimpleDotNetRSS
member.summary: Interface for retreiving a RSSChannel object.

member.name: M:SimpleDotNetRSS.ISimpleDotNetRSS.RSSOutPut
member.summary: Outputs an RSS Channel feed for that object

member.name: T:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSImage
member.summary: Used to add a single Image to your RSS feed. This is usually an image that represents the general content of the RSS feed or the company logo for the owener of the feed.

member.name: M:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSImage.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: If you don't want an Image use the default constructor and it will be ignored.

member.name: M:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSImage.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: is an optional sub-element of channel, which contains three (two supported) required and three optional sub-elements. The optional height and wi
member.param: is the URL of a GIF, JPEG or PNG image that represents the channel.
describes the image, it's used in the ALT attribute of the HTML img tag when the channel is rendered in HTML.
is the URL of the site, when the channel is rendered, the image is a link to the site. (Note, in practice the image title and link should have the same value as the channel's title and

member.name: M:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSImage.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: is an optional sub-element of channel, which contains three (two supported) required and three optional sub-elements.
member.param: the URL of a GIF, JPEG or PNG image that represents the channel.
describes the image, it's used in the ALT attribute of the HTML img tag when the channel is rendered in HTML.
is the URL of the site, when the channel is rendered, the image is a link to the site. (Note, in practice the image title and link should have the same value as the channel's title and link)
(Optional) Default is 88, max is 144(pixels)
(Optional) Default is 88, max is 144(pixels)

member.name: P:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSImage.ImageURL
member.summary: the URL of a GIF, JPEG or PNG image that represents the channel.

member.name: P:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSImage.ImageLink
member.summary: is the URL of the site, when the channel is rendered, the image is a link to the site. (Note, in practice the image title and link should have the same value as the channel's title and link)

member.name: P:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSImage.Width
member.summary: (Optional) Default is 88, max is 144(pixels)

member.name: P:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSImage.Height
member.summary: (Optional) Default is 88, max is 144(pixels)

member.name: T:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSChannel
member.summary: The Main object for creating an RSS feed. After one of these objects is initialized through a constructor you will be able to output the RSS as a formatted string using CreateRSS Method. The staic version of that method will create the rss for any RSSChannel object that is passed in, while the no static version will just create the RSS for it's self.

member.name: M:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSChannel.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSItem[])
member.summary: This creates the single channel element, which contains information about the channel (metadata) and its contents. This constructor provides only the required feilds
member.param: The name of the channel. It's how people refer to your service. If you have an HTML website that contains the same information as your RSS file, the title of your channel should be the same as the title of your website.
The URL to the HTML website corresponding to the channel.
Phrase or sentence describing the channel. Limit 200 Characters
The Array of Items that the Channel should include

member.name: M:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSChannel.AddToSkipDays(System.DayOfWeek)
member.summary: A hint for aggregators telling them which days they can skip.

member.name: M:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSChannel.CreateRSS(System.Web.UI.Page)
member.summary: Creates the RSS feed and stops the output of the current page.
member.param: The page to create the rss with

member.name: M:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSChannel.CreateRSS
member.summary: Creates the RSS for this RSSChannel
member.returns: The RSS 2.0 xml file in a string

member.name: M:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSChannel.MakeChannelHeader(System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary: Creates the header information for the RSS
member.param: The StringBuilder to add too.

member.name: M:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSChannel.MakeRSSImageTag(System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary: Adds an image to the feed.
member.param: The Stringbuilder you want the Image eliments added too.

member.name: M:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSChannel.MakeItems(SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSChannel,System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary: Creates the Items for the Channel that is passed in.
member.param: The Channel to generate the items from
The StringBuilder to add the xml too.

member.name: M:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSChannel.Add(SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSItem)
member.summary: Adds to the RSSItems that will be stored.
member.param: The RSS Item to add

member.name: M:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSChannel.AddRange(SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSItem[])
member.summary: Adds a range of RSSItems to the RSSChannel.
member.param: The RSSItems to store

member.name: M:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSChannel.Clear
member.summary: clears the RSSItems that are stored in the RSSChannel.

member.name: P:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSChannel.RssNamespaces
member.summary: The first value is the namespace name, the second is the url identifier.

member.name: P:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSChannel.ManagingEditorName
member.summary: The name of the managing Editor

member.name: P:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSChannel.WebMasterName
member.summary: The name of the Web Master

member.name: P:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSChannel.Items
member.summary: The Items contained in the RSS Channel

member.name: P:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSChannel.Title
member.summary: The name of the channel. It's how people refer to your service. If you have an HTML website that contains the same information as your RSS file, the title of your channel should be the same as the title of your website.

member.name: P:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSChannel.Link
member.summary: The URL to the HTML website corresponding to the channel.

member.name: P:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSChannel.Description
member.summary: Phrase or sentence describing the channel. Limit 200 Characters

member.name: P:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSChannel.Language
member.summary: The language the channel is written in. This allows aggregators to group all Italian language sites, for example, on a single page. A list of allowable values for this element, as provided by Netscape, is http://cyber.law.harvard.edu/rss/languages.html. You may also use values defined by the W3C.

member.name: P:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSChannel.Copyright
member.summary: Copyright notice for content in the channel. use © for ©.

member.name: P:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSChannel.MangingEditorEmail
member.summary: Email address for person responsible for editorial content.

member.name: P:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSChannel.WebMasterEmail
member.summary: Email address for person responsible for technical issues relating to channel.

member.name: P:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSChannel.PubDate
member.summary: The publication date for the content in the channel. For example, the New York Times publishes on a daily basis, the publication date flips once every 24 hours. That's when the pubDate of the channel changes. i.e. Sat, 07 Sep 2002 00:00:01 GMT

member.name: P:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSChannel.LastBuildDate
member.summary: The last time the content of the channel changed. i.e. Sat, 07 Sep 2002 00:00:01 GMT

member.name: P:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSChannel.Categorys
member.summary: Specify one or more categories that the channel belongs to. Follows the same rules as the item-level category element.

member.name: P:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSChannel.Ttl
member.summary: ttl stands for time to live. It's a number of minutes that indicates how long a channel can be cached before refreshing from the source

member.name: P:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSChannel.Image
member.summary: Specifies a GIF, JPEG or PNG image that can be displayed with the channel.

member.name: P:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSChannel.SkipHours
member.summary: A hint for aggregators telling them which hours they can skip.

member.name: P:SimpleDotNetRSS.RSSChannel.SkipDays
member.summary: Returns the days currently set to be skipped
